definition[0]: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried
example[0]: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
example[1]: He gave an assurance that the work would be completed by Wednesday.
definition[1]: a feeling of calm confidence about your own abilities, or that you are right about something
example[2]: the calm assurance with which she handled the horse
example[3]: ‘Jack will never agree to that, ’ he said with assurance.
definition[2]: insurance, especially to provide money when someone dies
definition[3]: a type of insurance against something that is certain to happen, especially someone’s death, as opposed to something that might happen such as an accident or a fire
